PBMC isolation by Ficoll Hypaque gradient centrifugation

body: recover the blood sample
put 15 ml of Ficoll Hypaque in 50 ml falcon and carefully add 30 ml of blood
repeat it for the whole blood sample
centrifugate at 400G during 22 minutes without break at RT
recover and pool the rings containing the PBMC in Baxter medium in 50 ml falcon
wash and centrifugate at 200G during 13 minutes at 4°C to separate platelet

recover the PBMC pellet in Baxter medium and count it at 1/100
  


Magnetic separation of Treg cells
centrifugate the PBMC at 300G during 5 minutes at 4°C
incubate the PBMC with the anti-CD25 beads : 4.5 x 10^8 cells per ml were incubated with 50 µl of beads for 20 min at 4°C in Baxter medium
wash and centrifugate at 300G during 5 minutes at 4°C
resuspend at 2 x 10^8 cells per ml in Baxter medium
perform the MACS separation using LS column according to Miltenyi protocol
recover the negative fraction \(CD25- containing the Teff cells and APC) in a 50 ml falcon and the positive fraction \(CD25+ containing the Treg cells) in a 5 ml falcon

Count both fraction
  Note : the protocol can be stopped at this step over night





Magnetic separation of Teff cells
centrifugate about 100-150M cells from the CD25- fraction at 300G during 5 minutes at 4°C
incubate them with the anti-CD4 beads : 1 x 10^8 cells per ml were incubated with 10 µl of beads for 20 min at 4°C in Baxter medium
wash and centrifugate at 300G during 5 minutes at 4°C
resuspend at 2 x 10^8 cells per ml in Baxter medium
perform the MACS separation using LS column according to Miltenyi protocol
recover the negative fraction \(CD25-CD4- containing the APC) in a 50mL falcon and the positive fraction \(CD25-CD4+ containing the Teff cells) in a 5mL falcon

Count both fraction
  Note : Teff cells are frozen if they have to be used another day





Magnetic separation and preparation of APC \(if needed)
centrifugate the CD25-CD4- fraction at 300G during 5 minutes at 4°C
incubate them with the anti-CD14 and anti-CD19 beads : 1 x 10^8 cells per ml were incubated with 10 µl of each bead type for 20 min at 4°C in Baxter medium
wash and centrifugate at 300G during 5 minutes at 4°C
resuspend at 2 x 10^8 cells per ml in Baxter medium
perform the MACS separation using LS column according to Miltenyi protocol
recover the positive fraction \(CD25-CD4-CD14+CD19+, containing the APC) in a 5mL falcon
wash in culture medium and centrifugate at 300G during 5 minutes at 4°C
irradiate the APC at 50 Grey
wash in culture medium and centrifugate at 300G during 5 minutes at 4°C

Count the APC fraction
  


FACS sorting of Treg cells
centrifugate the CD25+ fraction at 300G during 5 minutes at 4°C

incubate the pellet at 5 x 10^7 cells per ml during 20 minutes at 4°C with the following antibodies :
  anti-CD4 PerCP \(1/20)


anti-CD25 PE \(1/20)


anti-CD127 BV451 \(1/40)


anti-CD45RA PE-Cyanine7 \(1/10)
wash and centrifugate at 300G during 5 minutes at 4°C
resuspend the pellet at 20 x 10^6 cells per ml, filter the solution and tranfer it in a 5 ml FACS tube

Sort the Treg cells using Aria accordingly :
  CD4+CD25+IL-7Ra-CD45RA+ for naive Treg cells


CD4+CD25+IL-7Ra-CD45RA- for memory Treg cells
after sorting, wash in PBS and centrifugate Treg cells at 400G during 10 minutes at 4°C
wash the cells with culture medium and transfer them in eppendorf tube
centrifugate at 300G during 5 minutes

count both fraction
  Note : from this point Treg cells can be used for suppressive assay or preincubation





Treg cell preincubation \(if needed)
count and resuspend the cells at 1-3 x 10^5 cells per 300 ul
prepare a solution of IL-2 concentrate 5X at 1500 UI/ml \(300 UI/ml final)
prepare a solution of TNF concentrate 5X at 250 ng/ml \(50 ng/ml)
distribute 300 ul of Treg cells in a 48-well plates
add 100 ul of the IL-2 or/and the TNF to complete to 500 ul

incubate at 37°C during 20h to 72h
  


CFSE labelling of the Teff cells
wash the Teff cells in PBS and centrifugate them at 300G during 5 minutes at 4°C
repeat the step
incubate the Teff cells with 1 uM CFSE at 1 x 10^7 cells per ml in PBS during 5 minutes at RT

stop the reaction with 1/5 of FCS 
  during 1 minute
wash in Complete medium and centrifugate the cells at 300G during 5 minutes at 4°C
repeat step

Count the Teff cells
  


All suppressive assays are performed in U-bottom 96-well plates with 10<sup>4 CFSE labelled Teff cells and 10</sup>4 to 1.25 x 10^3 Treg cells \(1:1 to 1:8) in 200 µl of culture medium at 37°C 5% CO2 during 4 days. Some wells with Teff cells alone are used as positive control of proliferation and are also used to determine the direct effect of TNF on Teff cells.





Suppressive assay with beads
resuspend the Treg cells at 10^4 cells per 50 ul and make serial dilution \(1 to 2)
resuspend the Teff cells at 10^4 cells per 100 ul
prepare a solution of TNF concentrate 4X at 200 ng/ml \(50 ng/ml final) if needed
add anti-CD3/CD28 beads to the Teff cells solution to be at 10^3 beads per 100 ul

distribute the different solutions : Teffs cells + beads \(100 ul), Treg cells \(50 ul) then TNF \(50 ul) in the appropriate wells in duplicate for each condition.
  


Suppressive assay with APC and coated anti-CD3
coat a U-bottom 96-well plate with 0.5 ug/ml of anti-CD3 \(100 ul per well) during 2h at 37°C
resuspend the Treg cells at 10^4 cells per 50 ul and make serial dilution \(1 to 2)
resuspend the Teff cells at 10^4 cells per 50 ul
resuspend the APC at 10^5 cells per 50 ul and mix it at equal volume with the Teff cells solution
prepare a solution of TNF concentrate 4X at 200 ng/ml \(50 ng/ml final) if needed
Wash the plates 2 times with 150 ul of PBS without letting the plate dry

distribute the different solutions : Teffs cells + APC \(100 ul), Treg cells \(50 ul) then TNF \(50 ul) in the appropriate wells in duplicate for each condition.
  


Suppressive assay with APC and soluble anti-CD3
resuspend the Treg cells at 10^4 cells per 50 ul and make serial dilution \(1 to 2)
resuspend the Teff cells at 10^4 cells per 50 ul
resuspend the APC at 10^5 cells per 50 ul and mix it at equal volume with the Teff cells solution
add anti-CD3 to the Teff cells + APC solution to be concentrate 2X at 10 ug/ml \(5 ug/ml final)
prepare a solution of TNF concentrate 4X at 200 ng/ml \(50 ng/ml final) if needed

distribute the different solutions : Teffs cells + APC + anti-CD3 \(100 ul), Treg cells \(50 ul) then TNF \(50 ul) in the appropriate wells in duplicate for each condition. 
  


FACS Analysis
centrifugate the U-bottom 96-well plate at 300G during 5 minutes at 4°C
incubate the cells in 50 ul of PBS+3%FCS during 15 minutes at 4°C with the anti-CD4 PerCP antibodies Biolegend \(1/100)
wash in PBS+3%FCS and centrifugate the plate at 300G during 5 minutes at 4°C

resuspend in 200 ul of PBS+3%FCS and analyse by FACS
  


Calcul of the percentage of suppression


For each Teff/Treg ratio, the percentage of suppression was calculated with the following formula: \[Log2\(y) of \(Teff cells alone) - Log2\(y) of \(Teff + Treg cells]) / Log2\(y) of \(Teff cells alone) X 100. The y value corresponds to the mean fluorescent intensity of CFSE of the whole Teff cell population divided by the mean fluorescent intensity of CFSE of undivided Teff cells.
